titleproper.value:
Guide to the Lee Snider Photograph Collection
                    <lb/>ca. 1977-2009
                    <lb/>
                    <num>MSS 248</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Ashley Todd, 2009; Brent Phillips, 2009

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2016-06-22T12:13-0400</date>

p.value: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/> Identification of item, date (if known); Lee Snider Photograph Collection; MSS 248; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
Included in Lee's photo journalism coverage are images from many seminal events in the New York City LGBT community's history starting in 1977 when he first commenced his career as a photographer.
The Lee Snider Photograph Collection is comprised of black and white prints, color slides, and photo cds documenting AIDS activism and Gay Pride, primarily in New York City, from 1977 through 2009.

subject.value: AIDS activists |z New York (State) |z New York.
Gay activists |z New York (State) |z New York.
